articles.title: What will Trump say during the State of the Union? Here’s what prediction markets think.
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing the odds on specific topics, phrases, and policy announcements Trump might include in his upcoming State of the Union address. These bets offer early signals on which campaign promises he'll prioritize and how he'll frame his agenda, giving traders a way to profit from political theater while revealing crowd wisdom about presidential messaging strategy.

articles.title: Feds challenge state authority in prediction markets turf war
articles.summary: Federal regulators are pushing back against states trying to regulate prediction markets within their borders, creating a jurisdictional showdown over who gets to call the shots. The outcome will determine whether prediction markets face a patchwork of conflicting state rules or get clearer federal oversight that could either legitimize the industry or crush it entirely.

articles.title: Buzz of the Week: How should Utah handle online sports betting through ‘prediction markets’?
articles.summary: Utah legislators are debating whether to allow online sports betting by classifying it as "prediction markets" rather than traditional gambling. This semantic sleight of hand could open the floodgates for sports betting in one of America's most restrictive gambling states while potentially legitimizing prediction markets as a workaround for anti-gambling laws nationwide.

articles.title: Protracted legal fight expected in Nevada v. Kalshi
articles.summary: Nevada is gearing up for a lengthy legal battle against prediction market platform Kalshi, likely over regulatory jurisdiction or compliance issues. The outcome will set crucial precedent for how states can regulate prediction markets operating within their borders, potentially reshaping the entire industry's legal landscape.

articles.title: Senators tell CFTC to make clear ban on prediction market contracts involving deaths
articles.summary: A group of senators is pushing the CFTC to explicitly ban prediction market contracts that bet on when people will die. This could signal broader regulatory scrutiny coming for prediction markets, especially those touching sensitive topics that lawmakers view as crossing ethical lines.

articles.title: Trump's favorite words set to win traders millions tonight - including 8-letter zinger that's runaway favorite
articles.summary: Prediction markets are lighting up with bets on Trump's exact word choices during tonight's speech, with traders wagering millions on his signature phrases and one mysterious 8-letter word dominating the action. Smart money knows Trump's verbal tics are as predictable as his policy positions, turning his rhetorical habits into a goldmine for bettors who've studied his greatest hits.

articles.title: Kalshi removes X affiliate badges after policy shift tightens promotion rules
articles.summary: Kalshi pulled its affiliate badges from X after the platform tightened rules around promotional content, likely forcing the prediction market to rethink its influencer marketing strategy. The move signals how social media crackdowns on financial promotions could squeeze prediction markets' ability to reach new users through creator partnerships.

articles.title: Election betting boom sparks midterm brawl in California
articles.summary: California's midterm elections are generating massive betting volume, triggering fights over regulation and market access. The Golden State's gambling laws remain murky around political wagering, so this could set precedent for how other states handle the growing election betting market.

articles.title: Trump Regulatory Path for Prediction Markets Not Slowing Courts
articles.summary: Federal courts are continuing to push forward with prediction market cases despite expectations that Trump's return could bring more favorable regulations to the industry. The legal momentum means platforms can't just wait for regulatory relief and still need to fight existing battles, which could drain resources and create uncertainty even if the political winds are shifting in their favor.

articles.title: Who will ZachXBT expose as 'insider traders' on Thursday? Polymarket thinks these firms
articles.summary: Crypto sleuth ZachXBT plans to drop names of firms he claims engaged in insider trading this Thursday, and Polymarket bettors are wagering on which companies will get called out. The expose could trigger major market moves across crypto assets and create new betting opportunities as traders position ahead of potential regulatory fallout.

articles.title: Kalshi Abandons Affiliate Badges After Twitter’s Policy Shift
articles.summary: Kalshi ditched its affiliate badge program on Twitter after the platform changed its policies around promotional content markers. The move signals how quickly prediction markets must adapt their marketing strategies when social media platforms tighten their grip on financial promotions.

articles.title: The Early Line: Utah Doesn't Love Prediction Markets
articles.summary: Utah's legislature is moving to ban or heavily restrict prediction markets, bucking the national trend toward legalization. The crackdown could signal broader regulatory backlash just as the industry gains mainstream acceptance, potentially spooking other conservative states eyeing similar bans.
